application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

div.p: Motivation and objectives The proportionate affine projection algorithm (PAPA) has a good .=
convergence speed and low computational complexity. It is well known that it has superior performance to APA. .=
Recently, two proportionate-type APA called MIPAPA was developed, taking into account the “history” of the proportionate factors. .=
It was shown that they have better performance than IPAPA .=
 To validate its performance and compare it with other algorithms .=
 To identify the strengths and weaknesses of the algorithm .=

The far-end signal goes through the echo path h, providing the echo signal. The echo signal is added with the near-end signal (which can contain both the background noise and the near-end speech), resulting the microphone signal. The adaptive filter aims to produce at its output an estimate of the echo, while the error signal should contain an estimate of the near-end signal. .=
Solve S  n  ε  n   e  n  using the DCD method (8) .=

FMIPAPA-DCD has been proposed for echo cancellation. .=
It is improved version of IPAPA algorithm with reduced .=
A fast recursive filtering procedure is used. It exploits the .=
The influence of the number of DCD iterations on .=
algorithm performance is investigated. As expected, if .=
more DCD iterations are performed, better performances .=

Relevant references D. L. Duttweiler, “Proportionate normalized least-mean-squares adaptation in echo .=
cancellers,” IEEE Trans. Speech Audio Process., vol. 8, no. 5, pp. 508–518, Sept. .=
H. Deng and M. Doroslovački, “Proportionate adaptive algorithms for network echo .=
cancellation,” IEEE Trans. Signal Process., vol. 54, no. 5, pp. 1794–1803, May 2006. .=

to an affine subspace and its properties,” Electron. Commun. Jpn., vol. 67-A, no. 5, pp. .=

Electronics Letters, Oct. 2004, pp. 1451-1453, Vol. 40, Issue:22 .=

algorithm,” IEEE Signal Processing Letters, vol. 12, pp. 353–356, May 2005 .=
Y. Zakharov, “Low complexity implementation of the affine projection algorithm”, IEEE .=
